Participant Privacy Policy

This privacy policy (Privacy Policy) will help you understand what information we collect for the Project, why we collect it, how we will use it, including if and how we share the information with third parties, and the choices you have with respect to your information. When we talk about “we,” “our,” or “us” in this Privacy Policy, we are referring to Navana Tech India Private Limited (Navana Tech). When we talk about “you” in this Privacy Policy, we are referring to the participant / voice data contributor.


By agreeing to the Speech Recognition in Agriculture and Finance for the Poor in India - Consent Form, you expressly agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy, for your use of Navana Tech's voice data collection application ( App) and for the collection, processing, storage, use, disclosure, transfer and otherwise handling of your personal and sensitive personal data in accordance with the terms contained below.  You have the option to not provide your sensitive personal data (as defined under applicable law) to us, or withdraw consent once provided, however, we will not be able to provide you with access to the App in case you elect to do so and further would be unable to process payment to you. If you do not wish to provide us with your sensitive personal data please do not use the App and uninstall it from your devices.    


We may revise the Privacy Policy from time to time. While we may not be able to separately notify you of the revisions each time that we make them, we will notify you and obtain your consent for any changes that we make to this policy when required under law. We encourage you to check this page periodically for modifications or revisions to the Privacy Policy to understand how it affects the use of your information.


Any personal information collected in accordance with this Privacy Policy will be collected and retained by us.


  1. INFORMATION WE COLLECT AND RECEIVE

  1. Personal Information Collected from You

  • Registration Information: The registration process may require you to sign-in with your phone number. This information will be used to identify you on the platform when you close the App and open it again. The App will also ask you to choose a profile picture. This picture will only be used for display in the App and will not be stored on our platform.

  • Demographic Data: We will collect some demographic information about you, e.g., your age range, gender, education level, the State you are in, your mother tongue and languages you can read, write and speak, for research related purposes and to improve our algorithm.

  • Identity Verification Information: We also collect your name and PAN card details for the purposes of mapping with your voice sample and for other administrative purposes.  

  • Location Information: We may collect your geographical location which will be restricted to an area of a village. We will not however require your GPS coordinates.

  • Information for the purpose of promotion/posters: We may use pictures from the study in presentations or posters without identifying specific individuals. We will request your permission before taking pictures and obtain your permission to use those pictures in our presentations or posters. Not providing consent for taking pictures will not disqualify you from participating in the study.

  1. Sensitive Personal Information collected from you:

  • Password Information: To begin, you will be introduced to the Project Coordinator for your location. This person will be your point of contact for help related to the project. Your project coordinator will provide you with instructions and if necessary, help you download and install the App on your smartphone. Your project coordinator will give you a "16-digit Access Code". You need to enter the code during the registration process. Each access code can be used only once. Therefore, do not share the access code with anyone else.

Payment Information: You will be paid for all correctly completed tasks on the platform. We will pay you periodically for all your tasks that have undergone quality verification. You will be paid up to Rs. 15 per validated sentence submitted and up to Rs. 1 per validated audio file submitted. The financial information we collect for the purpose of payment may include information such as your credit card number, your debit card number, your bank account number, bank IFSC code, your UPI handle, payment wallet information and net-banking details. The information we collect would depend on the payment method that you use. We may pass this information on to our third-party payment services vendors, or these entities may also directly collect this information from you. We will collect and store your payment information for the duration of the study. We will delete all payment information as soon as your participation is completed. Please contact your project coordinator if you have any queries regarding payments. We will not store this information, if we are not permitted under applicable law.  


  • Health Related Information: We may collect certain health related information about you such as if you have been diagnosed with any speech related disorders in the past and if you are on any medications to treat the disorder. We will require you to answer questions in relation to speech disorders as either yes or no.

  1. Non-Personal Information:

  • Feedback information: After the end of the study, we may request a short interview with you to gather your feedback and understand your experience of using our platform.

  • Dataset Information: Datasets will contain only text or audio data that is not associated with personally identifiable information and will be used to create speech recognition technology. If you have any questions regarding how the dataset will be used, please feel free to ask through your project coordinator.

B.        PURPOSE OF COLLECTION


Any personal information we collect during the study will only be used to identify you during the duration of the study.


Purpose of collection:


We use personal information of Users for the following purposes:


  • Administrative and Legal Purposes: We will access and use your data as reasonably necessary to (a) provide, maintain and improve the App; (b) prevent or address service, security, technical issues, or at your request in connection with support matters; © act in a manner required by law; (d) register you with the App and complete identity verification; (e) to enable payments to you; (f) to create datasets as mentioned above for open access; and (g) act in the manner expressly permitted in writing by you.

  • To improve our App and Services: We will access and use your data to carry out research and analyze trends to better improve our algorithm.

  • We will access and use your data for other purposes you consent to, are notified of, or are disclosed when you provide personal information.

At the end of your participation, we request you to delete the application from your phone. Should you want, your project coordinator will aid you in uninstalling, configuring, and deleting the application.


C.        YOUR CHOICES Access to Personal Data or Information


You will have the right, upon request, to access, change, modify and review the personal information provided by you and held by us. Upon discovering that the information provided is inaccurate or deficient in any manner, you will have the right to request suitable changes or amendments to such information, which will be carried out by us, when feasible.


You will also have the option of withdrawing consent by reaching out to us at operations@navanatech.in. However, exercising this option will hamper our ability to provide you with any or all of the features of the App.


D.        SHARING AND DISCLOSURE


We will not publish or disclose your personal information without your prior consent, unless we are required to do so in order to facilitate use of the App, it is for the Purposes (as indicated in Part B), it is mandated by law, or if you have previously provided your consent. We may disclose personal information with our employees, officers, agents, consultants, business associates, contractors, attorneys, etc., on a need-to-know basis for the Purposes.


We will disclose any sensitive personal data and information if there is a legal requirement or if we are ordered to do so by a court of competent jurisdiction or to any government agency if required by law for the purposes of verification of identity, or for prevention, detection, or investigation of crime (including cyber incidents), or for prosecution or punishment of offences.


E.        TRANSFER


We do not transfer personal information pertaining to you to third parties.


F.        SECURITY


We ensure the confidentiality and security of the personal information and sensitive personal data and information provided by you by implementing comprehensive information security practices and standards as mandated by the Data Protection Rules.


G.        GRIEVANCE OFFICER


Should you have any questions in relation to this Privacy Policy , you may address them to our grievance officer whose name and email address are as follows:

[●] Raoul Nanavati

[●] operations@navanatech.in


  In case you do not have access to email, you can contact your project coordinator, and have them relay your concerns to the grievance officer.
Please Wait. Downloading files and other assets.
You have entered an invalid creation code.
The creation code you have entered is already used. Please contact your project coordinator.
We were unable to send OTP to your number. Please try again later.
We have sent you a 6-digit OTP via SMS. Please enter that OTP below
You have entered an invalid OTP
Please click your profile picture. You can skip this step if you do not want a profile picture
Please choose your gender. If you do not wish to state your gender, you can skip this step
Please enter your year of birth
Your phone number is already registered. Please try with another phone number.
We have three questions about your skills in English. For each question, please click tick for yes, and cross for no.
Failed to register new skill for worker
If you know any other language, please select that language below
You have completed tasks that can be submitted to the server. Do you want to submit the tasks now?
This task consists of a set of sentences. The worker is expected to record themselves reading out each sentence, one sentence at a time
This task consists of a set of stories. The worker is expected to record themselves reading out each story, one sentence at a time
This task consists of a set of recordings. The worker is expected to verify the given recording and text.
You have to record yourself speaking out this sentence
To start recording, press this button. It will turn red indicating that the recording has started.
Once you are done recording, press this button again to stop the recording
The app will play back the recorded audio. Listen to it carefully to ensure it is correct and that there is no other background voice.
If your recording is not correct, you can record again using the record button.
If you are happy with the recording, you can press this button to go to the next sentence.
You can press this button to go to the previous sentence.
